intro: Agrostophyllum finisterrae, commonly known as the Canary Islands rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent, evergreen leaves. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
